website_summaries.verdict: Tap into your baby's ability to discern shape and colors and is easy to take with toy.
pros: Suitable for babies, yet ideal for children 1 year of age and older
This activity center is packaged in a carrying case that zips tightly, preserving parts
Introduces STEM principles by encouraging babies to recognize space and shapes
cons: The product's colors can run when cleaning

customer_reviews.title: both loved playing with it
customer_reviews.text: Took this along on a 1 month trip overseas with a 22 month old and a 7 month old. Because of each of their needs takes up so much space, toys are limited to just a few versatile basic ones. Thought it was purchased for the almost 2 yr old, both loved playing with it. Most notably though the almost 2 yr old who loves practicing shapes. It is small and collapsible, making it great to travel with. We used it on the international flights and in the hotel rooms at night to help entertain the kids.
customer_reviews.author: kathia

customer_reviews.title: Toddler frustration
customer_reviews.text: Like the double side and zipper for added fine motor practice, but the pouch is not deep enough. Sometimes the shapes do not fall completly into the holes (picture 1), because it's made of material rather than a sold plastic (which is nice because it doesn't crack if stepped on). Or if picked up the shapes fall to the bottom so you can't put the bottom shapes im the holes (picture 2). Causes some toddler frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Kauffman

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: I will start by saying we usually love melissa and doug products, which is why i was so disappointed in this one. It is so poorly designed. As the other reviewers have stated (and i should have listened) the box is way too shallow and it results in frustration on the part of the toddler playing with it as the shapes have no where to go. An adult needs to sit there and shake the box each time to make room for the next one. Really disappointing product that had so much potential.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great portable shape sorter
customer_reviews.text: My 26 month old loves this toy! He initially got frustrated when a shape inside blocking the correct shapes. Once he saw me move the shapes out of the way a few times he was able to do it on his own. He likes to put the shapes into the slots, name the shapes and colors, as well as turn the bag over and name the objects the shapes corresponds to. This is the first thing he looks for when he wakes up and he loves to carry it around by its handle.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great for 6 month old
customer_reviews.text: My 6 month old loves it- pieces are a good size for her to hold and still put in her mouth. She even manages to flip it over and play with the paper flaps on the opposite side of the shape holes. Washed up great when washed by hand. Great for taking along to grandmas.
customer_reviews.author: Dewey Ceniceros

customer_reviews.title: Educational and Fun First Year and Beyond
customer_reviews.text: Perfect educational toy for my 5.5 month old, something she can enjoy and continue to learn from throughout the year. The case is cute, soft and safe for my little one to handle. Shaking the case is fun for my little one to watch, she can play with the flaps on the back both sitting up and for tummy time. Only downside is that the case is not very deep so pushing the shapes in can be difficult as they don't "fall" in and sometimes when you flip the case the shapes will fall out. Overall a wonderful product that I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: The good: Perfect size to carry around
customer_reviews.text: It's okay. The good: Perfect size to carry around. Soft sides make it easy to tote also. The zipper grip is a good feature allowing kids to open and close the zipper easily. The krinkle paper on the reverse side is good entertainment for the youngest babies. The not so good: Pieces sometimes fall out when being toted around. Also, due to the shallow depth it is frustrating at times for kids to insert shapes in the middle or bottom rows when previously inserted pieces are inside blocking the way--just look at the product picture and imagine a youngster trying to insert a shape in the bottom row when all the other pieces are in the way--see what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Take-Along Toy
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this toy. It's colorful, sturdy and just cries to be played with. I read a lot of the reviews before I bought this and saw again and again that it was too shallow, but I don't find that to be the case. The blocks drop in just fine! There's even room for a small dump truck to fit in the bag. You know, so he can transport the block before he puts it in the bag! I bought this for my 1 year old grandson and he loves it! Definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Pros and cons
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this item is beyond! Love the stuffed animal attached to the zipper. Makes it easier for kids to zip. Only downfall is you on get one of every shape and the bag is only big enough for one layer when you push in a shape so the shape doesn’t move making it obvious to my child which spots are still open for a shape. I’d prefer some more depth so the toy would fall down away from the opening
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Deuso

customer_reviews.title: nice idea...not a sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: my son love it from the beginning, but on the first try the zipper would only unzip halfway and there as nothing stuck and no way to fix it. we got a replacement but when he tries to put the blocks into the shapes the back of the bag prohibits them from going all the way in (like the back of the fabric is warped inward, in some strange way) we still kept it but he has quickly discarded it as a favorite toy since he cannot match the blocks to the shapes and keep them inside the bag without sturggling. #disappointed (especially because this brand toy isn't cheap!)
customer_reviews.author: MaggieMae

customer_reviews.title: Compact toy that does a lot
customer_reviews.text: It is light and easy to carry around, but it is a great toy that lets your baby explore crinkly textures and peek-a-boo flaps on the back, manipulate the plastic shapes, look at different colors, put shapes into (and dump from) the open bag, and sort shapes through the holes. It is a surprisingly effective toy despite its simplicity (maybe because of it?). Added bonus: there is a little bit of extra room in the bag, so if you're traveling or going on vacation you can throw in a few other small toys to take with and keep all your baby stuff in the same place.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves it--takes it everywhere
customer_reviews.text: My step-daughter said that grandson loves sorting shapes with a passion. I mean, what 1.5 year old doesn't? Bought it as a surprise COVID gift as a way to have something new and different during lockdown. He immediately sat down and started trying to figure out where the shapes went, and his momma states that he takes it everywhere. He will even play with it in the car (though I can't imagine what she does when he begins the pterodactyl scream if he drops a piece...) Bright, colorful--great gift for the young toddler/future engineer.
customer_reviews.author: "beachmcat"

customer_reviews.title: So much yes
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my 8 month old son’s favorite toys to play with at home and on the go, since he was about 6 months old. He doesn’t know how to put the shapes in the slots yet, but he loves the shapes themselves, taking them out of the bag, chewing on the them, and crinkling the tabs on the back. When we took it on a trip, I also stored other toys in the bag as long as they weren’t smaller than the holes on the back. I would definitely buy this for my friends when they have kids.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Fun for a shape-learner and as a "purse"
customer_reviews.text: My toddler (18 mon) loves the zipper on this thing. She hasn't quite figured out how shapes work yet, but she loves unzipping, putting toys inside, and zipping it back up, then she carries it around like a purse. Soft material but quite durable. The shapes may be a bit too small for little ones who are still putting everything in their mouths.
customer_reviews.author: Wheeler985

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME for baby or toddler
customer_reviews.text: From infant to going on 2 years, ours has loved this.. just passing time playing with the parts, actually learning where they go, and on to learning all the color and shape name, we still love using this.. great gift!
customer_reviews.author: Jade C

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: It’s not the toys fault. The toy itself is fine. It’s just that the distributor failed to mention that it was missing pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Amy G.

customer_reviews.title: Shapes don’t drop. Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I thought my daughter would really like this because it’s a bag she can carry around. However the main function, sorting shapes, doesn’t really work. The plastic shapes don’t ‘drop’ well into the bag and once there’s more than a few shapes in there they don’t go in and the plastic shape just sticks halfway out. I should have just got the cheap fisher price bucket one where the shapes actually drop in there. I would return this but I already recycled the box. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay, there are better
customer_reviews.text: A few things that I didn't like about this (bought for my 21 month old for a plane ride) 1) as other reviewers say its noisy. Very cheap plastic 2) its bulky. 3) the shapes are easy for toddlers. my 21 month old was not challenged and had the parts in the right spots in under 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More compact easy soft
customer_reviews.text: Best part is: soft container- doesn’t take up too much room, can shove on any cubbie, soft for the kid at any age. You end up with too many huge plastic bins for different things these shapes fit perfect they can practice using the zipper. I even leave it unzipped sometimes. Best shape sorted option
customer_reviews.author: kregar1

customer_reviews.title: Collapses Too Easily
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to make this purchase because I wanted a new toy for my LO that would help with promoting his development. I gave this toy 3 stars because I liked the side with small flaps and make a crinkle sounds when being played with, but the side where the shapes are supposed to be inserted is underwhelming. I say this because it’s not sturdy enough for a small child to successfully play with it because it easily collapses which makes it difficult to insert the shapes. Take it from me save your money and purchase something else.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is obsessed with this. She hasn’t figured out the shape thing yet but she loves the little toys and is intrigued with the zipper. I love it has the little plush toy to make it easier to grab. And when she’s done, we can easily put it all away and keep it together.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping to keep my almost 3 year old and my 10 month old occupied on a flight recently. While it didn’t keep them occupied the entire trip, it was useful for both of them and compact enough that I could bring it on the plane. Very functional and cute design!
customer_reviews.author: LCD

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Toy for 16 Month Old Child
customer_reviews.text: Our 16 month old son LOVES this shape sorter. He has played with it for several months now, but in the past several weeks he is able to accurately sort all the shapes independently which is so fun to watch. We like the design and quality as we do with most Melissa and Doug products. We also like the portability of this item as we can easily take it along when we go on trips. It's one of our son's favorite toys and it's our go to present for first birthdays.
customer_reviews.author: Momma LL

customer_reviews.title: well made, travelable gift!!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is well made! My grandson is 2, Its great for learning shapes and colors, and he learned to work a zipper with this toy! I loved the bear hanging from the zipper, it helped him manipulate it! it would make a good travel toy. he carries it around the house and loves that it has a handle! It is well made and sturdy!!
customer_reviews.author: jan b

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy in its own carry case
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 10 month old grand daughter. We liked it because it’s all in one and self contained in a soft carry case and a good price. It turns out that our 3 year old loves to carry it around and play with it also. She is showing her baby sister how to play with it. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: debra rubin

customer_reviews.title: I really like this toy
customer_reviews.text: I really like this toy. I was afraid since it stated that it could be for 9 months and up that it would be to young for my 2 year old granddaughter. She apparently loved it. It is good for up to 3 or 4. It’s great because she can carry it like a purse. All the blocks fit inside the purse. I highly recommend this purse. I liked it so much I ordered 2 of them. One for my house and one to take home.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Kulp

customer_reviews.title: ... my 2yr old who already knew colors and very good at sorting shapes
customer_reviews.text: As much as I am excited to buy this product for my 2yr old who already knew colors and very good at sorting shapes, we thought to use this as a carry on toy in our car journeys but the shapes doesn't go inside very well, I need to help my son by pulling the underneath cloth so the shape will get in better. Its kind of frustration for the little ones. But he likes playing with the zip and the backside part of the toy where there are little flaps to open and reveal a surprise. He likes it so much but the toy in general not supporting its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: VSEN

customer_reviews.title: Very cute, only noticed one issue
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this shape sorter and I like that it challenges him with the more advanced shapes, but the zipper dog fell off and I had to add my own string for him to be able to open/close it again. I think they should consider a different zipper charm, one with metal holding it on instead of string that frays and breaks off easily.
customer_reviews.author: DecorQueen173

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for little learners
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a birthday gift for my 1 year old. He loves to carry it around and I delight in watching his fine motor skills progress. Bright colors, well made, Melissa & Doug never disappoint. The packaging wasn’t damaged terribly, I wouldn’t hesitate to gift this to someone other than my kiddo.
customer_reviews.author: Crschoa

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy, some design flaws
customer_reviews.text: A fun toy for toddlers, and nice and neat since everything can be stored in the zipped case, but the case isn't deep enough. When the child tries to push the shape into the slot, especially when there are already a few inside, they don't fully go in because the case is too shallow and soft. Understandably, this could be frustrating to a small child.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Y.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, arrived early enough so that I could wrap it up and give it to my nephew, great gift for a baby.
customer_reviews.author: Alyson

customer_reviews.title: This is my 15-month-old son's favorite toy; Since I bought it
customer_reviews.text: This is my 15-month-old son's favorite toy; Since I bought it, he's played with it every single day, and no other toy gets so much attention from him. The only thing I did not like was the big plus toy hanging from a string to serve as the zipper pull. I liked it even less when the stitching came out after less than a week and now I have to use a paper clip to get the zipper open. Other than this unfortunate design flaw, it is a great toy. I would probably buy it again, if only because of how much my kid loves it.
customer_reviews.author: The Atwaters

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel, especially flights
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our airplane trips for our little one. He loved it and it was light enough that it wasn’t a pain to carry. He did stuff other toys in there such as his cars. The only downsize is that every once in a while one of the pieces would fall out through the holes but overall was rare.
customer_reviews.author: Spoon

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy for baby or Toddler
customer_reviews.text: As with all Melisssa and Doug toys, this one is great, especially for travel. Side note: my 14 month old mastered the zipper after a week of playing with this toy, which isn’t great for him wearing a jacket now, but hey, learning is good even when inconvenient ha!
customer_reviews.author: Victor Bachand

customer_reviews.title: Everyone is different
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! This was purchased to replace pieces we had misplaced but I was suprised to get the new one and realize every color was different; that’s not a problem just something to know if your trying to replace parts and are expecting the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle G

customer_reviews.title: Good for a vacation; but take a zip up bag to store it in...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to take on vacation, which is what I got it for. Because it is made of material, except the top, its soft so it can flatten easily and the pieces can sometimes fall out. They should have a way to cover the holes when you are transporting it. So keep it in a plastic zip lock bag and you are good. We didn’t at first, and we lost a piece or two. Hoping we can get replacement pieces. I would recommend it, just store or transport it in a zip lock or zipper bag.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Not quite quiet
customer_reviews.text: We bought this toy to pack in our 'Church Only' toy bag. Our children do enjoy this for about 5 - 10 minutes then they lose interest and move on to other toys. No problem, except when they dump them out or bang them together they are really loud;-)!!!
customer_reviews.author: M Brown

customer_reviews.title: This is a good idea, but does not work
customer_reviews.text: This is a good idea, but does not work. After 3-4 pieces are in the bag, they block the holes for the other shapes and this is very frustrating for my 16 month old. You need to shake the bag to move the already inserted pieces to make room for the other pieces. The bag needs to be deeper or made of a hard material that will not collapse. I returned this item.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Smalley

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Saved our lives on a 16 hour plane journey with 1.5 years old. It occupied him for the most part. I just wish we got spare shapes or there was an option to buy extra because we had to look for them frantically every time he dropped one on the plane floor.
customer_reviews.author: A2Z

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and I am very happy I bought it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shape sorter for my granddaughter for Christmas last year. She plays with this all the time. She is only a toddler, so her shape concept is not there yet, but she enjoys putting the shapes in the box and closing the cover and then opening it and taking the shapes back out. I am trying to show her to match the shapes, so hopefully she will grasp it soon. This is very durable and the doggie on the zipper is firmly attached. Very well made and I am very happy I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L. Romage

customer_reviews.title: My one year old loves this
customer_reviews.text: She's at the stage where things need to be taken out and then put back away. It's a perfect toy to earn you 5 minutes of bliss on a world of chaos. The shapes are hard plastic and durable. The bag is soft. No choking hazards. Easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Sharpey

customer_reviews.title: Baby's happy with it - convenient travel toy
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is padded and has a zipper to keep all the shapes in. My 9 month old likes sucking on the handle and the little dog attached to the zipper. My only constructive feedback is that I think it could be ade to be a little deeper to allow the shapes to go in a little more easy. Right now they go in but unless you wiggle it a little to work it under the lip of the plastic, the shape pushes against the padded backing and so can technically come right back out.
customer_reviews.author: CDL

customer_reviews.title: Great idea in theory
customer_reviews.text: Great idea except that once some shapes are inside the bag, if the bag gets bumped or the shapes inside move around then they block the holes of the remaining shapes. My 16 month old likes the toy but he gets really pissed when he finally figures out where the shape goes but it won't go in. The bag is pretty soft though, so when he hurls it across the room because he's pissed, it hasn't broken anything and doesn't make a loud noise when it lands.
customer_reviews.author: K8

customer_reviews.title: Like this the best for the next step up from ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought a couple of shape sorters and have used a couple more in my work in early intervention. Like this the best for the next step up from a simple circle, square, triangle puzzle. (Melissa and Doug also make a nice large knob wooden puzzle of a house which would meet that first step.) This has all the shapes visible on one side, allows naming of common shapes, and includes zipping with an easy to hold bear attached to the zipper. And, oh, yes, the kids enjoyed it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stanfield

customer_reviews.title: I liked it...it kept my kid occupied in the car.
customer_reviews.text: I like this for the car. The self contained package is good. The activities that are on this keep my daughter (23 months) occupied for at least 20 min in the car (she isn't allowed to play with this at home). The only downside is that the main compartment that holds the different shapes is a bit too thin. When you put the shapes through the holes they bottom out before they are fully through the holes. This frustrates my daughter a bit. Other than that it's good and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: BluBtrfly

customer_reviews.title: I love that the blocks are stored within the carrying case
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 2 year old for Christmas. I love that the blocks are stored within the carrying case. They fit nicely in each cutout. The only issue we have had is there isn't alot of space between the openings and the inside of the bag. It makes it difficult when placing each shape into its proper spot. I am still very happy with this purchase and my daughter has enjoyed this toy. I would still recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Marshall

customer_reviews.title: good quality .. excellent for traveling
customer_reviews.text: I choose to buy this toy for my baby girl to take on plane with us. It was a good choice , very good quality , it has a handle to carry , a zipper with big charm so the baby can open it by her self. you can use it to discover the shapes and colors and even more. I just like it :)
customer_reviews.author: Mesk

customer_reviews.title: Cute gift idea
customer_reviews.text: That was my son’s first Christmas gift and he absolutely love it and he still loves to play with it and almost memorized the shapes ;)
customer_reviews.author: Sana

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for my 2 yr old!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a plane ride and was a huge hit with my 2 year old!! She loved this toy. it was easy to keep it together with the zippered storage, and the soft sides made it easy to pack in our carry on bags. My 4 year old would sneak it to play when it was sitting out on the table as well :)
customer_reviews.author: Katie A

customer_reviews.title: our 14 m/o loves this
customer_reviews.text: Light-weight and versatile -- shapes, colors, tactile development. She hasn't mastered the zipper yet, but loves to carry it around on her arm like a purse. Besides the colorful shapes, it can store other small toys too -- good for travel.
customer_reviews.author: jozm305

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Great toy—takes standard shape sorter and ups the game! Don’t microwave the pieces to sanitize them...they expand (learned the hard way).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: Sides too soft. Collapse easily which makes putting pieces in the holes But love how colorful and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Mccarty

customer_reviews.title: Great design for my 15 month old!
customer_reviews.text: I love love this shape sorter. I’ve done my research, returned another kind, and this one makes so much sense!! It’s durable, washable, and the labels on the back are a hit too. Keep doing what you do Melissa & Doug!
customer_reviews.author: Deme

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Toy
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for a coworkers 16 month old daughter he said it is great his daughter plays with it all the time. Soft and safe
customer_reviews.author: Cher

customer_reviews.title: Play and learn.
customer_reviews.text: Very cute and colorful toy. Feels sturdy and parts are easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great car seat toy
customer_reviews.text: This makes a great car seat toy! My daughter started playing with it around 13 months. Months later she still asks for it every time we buckle her in her car seat!
customer_reviews.author: bestam01

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Especially the crinkle backside with flaps. Only downside is sometimes shapes will fall out even when it's zipped up. By far my favorite shape sorter though.
customer_reviews.author: NatureLove

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a nice child's gift but.....
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning these as my son and daughter-in-law prefer wooden toys when possible. I will re-order wooden ones!
customer_reviews.author: caymanmom

customer_reviews.title: Adorable, durable Shape sorter
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES this shape set. It's one of his favorite toys. It's very durable and the little flaps on the back are so fun. He loves carrying the case around by the cute puppy zipper pull.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca B

customer_reviews.title: great toy for travel
customer_reviews.text: We bought this toy when my son was 19 months before trsvelling oversees. It'd great for travel because it's light, can keep a toddler busy for more than 1/2 h in a row, and you can store other small toys in it ( my son lovrs cars they fit perfectly I'm there they wouldn't be large enough to escape by the holes) but you have to know the life of this toy is short: my son was over it in 3 months
customer_reviews.author: frenchmom

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take with us on vacation. It kept my 8 month old daughter busy. I just wish there was a storage pouch for the shapes so they wouldn't fall all over the place. I improvised and used a ziploc baggie.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Melissa & Doug K's Kids Take-Along Shape sorter
customer_reviews.text: My son really liked this. It kept him entertained on a long car ride and during our hotel stay. It's a really adorable toy with so many cute and fun uses. The only thing that I wish is that they had something on the inside to zip in the shapes. They don't zip in so they are freely rolling around and falling out of the shape sorting openings.
customer_reviews.author: Gikat6

customer_reviews.title: Used on an airplane
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like the zipper there’s a stuffed toy attached to it makes that week. But overall my 2 1/2 year-old love this while flying
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Anders

customer_reviews.title: Very educational
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this toy. I take it everywhere. She doesn’t play like it’s meant to be because she’s only 10 months but now she is starting to understand it. I bought it when she was around 7-8 months, too little to comprehend.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son to take it with me on the plane. It looks exactly like the photos. It had some of the stuffing sticking out which I had to remove before handing it to my son. My only concern is their reappearance if my son starting gumming the bag or the doll on the zipper.
customer_reviews.author: HE

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids to learn colors and shapes
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it. Helps him learn shapes. Hes not able to do it himself yet but always brings me this toy and hits the pieces as I hold them over the correct shaped hole
customer_reviews.author: M5dre

customer_reviews.title: Fun for a 1 year old!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my best friend’s 1 year old daughter. She absolutely loved playing with the shapes and figuring out which holes each one fit in. This gift was a hit!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Nehlen

customer_reviews.title: Cute carry case
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 5 of these for presents and absolutely love them .... great for the car rides...definitely cute carrying case ...toddlers of all ages will love them... great buy ...
customer_reviews.author: Lark

customer_reviews.title: Fun.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use for the little ones. They enjoyed the different colors and shapes.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Greer

customer_reviews.title: Another great Melissa and Doug product.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this product. It’s soft, and easy for him to open and close. Still learning what fits where, but he loves to carry it around and play with it.
customer_reviews.author: elgee

customer_reviews.title: Nice, well sized toy to grow with
customer_reviews.text: Gifted this for an 8-month old. Clearly too young to be placing the pieces in shape holes but it's something she can use now as grasping, dumping the shapes out of bag, and flipping back flaps; and is a toy she can grow with.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna K

customer_reviews.title: Pieces fall out by themselves
customer_reviews.text: The pieces can fall out by themselves when the toy is zipped closed! We have lost two pieces because they have fallen out when my child was carrying it and I did not realize until we arrived at our destination.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Carmosinoi

customer_reviews.title: Great idea!
customer_reviews.text: My 19 month old loves this. I was hoping to use it in church but the shapes are plastic and make too much noise. Otherwise I am happy with it. It has a cute handle perfect for her to carry it around.
customer_reviews.author: Professional

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately baby got bored after first try and never seem to want to ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife brought this with the baby on an airplane trip, the only down side is the parts can come out from the hole if you don't shake them up. Unfortunately baby got bored after first try and never seem to want to play with it anymore. Maybe wait till she's older she might pick this up again. She is one year old now.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmun

customer_reviews.title: Such good fun
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year olds love this! We take it on trips and it keeps them entertained for a good chunk of time. Well about as long as 2 toddlers can sit still. The panels on the back are bent and don’t quite cover each square, but the shape side is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Arizonian

customer_reviews.title: They love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for our home and one for a niece so adorable
customer_reviews.author: superradicalxo

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: First time parent. This is a great little learning tool. My 10 month old is to young to be dropping the shapes in the holes but he loves the plastic shapes themselves and the tag flaps on the reverse side. As he gets a little older he'll have fun fitting the shapes in place. Soft carry case with zipper is a plus. Easy to take along. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: S.S.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Dear son loves this one, he likes bouncing each pieces in cement he like the sound of it. Overall very helpful for my baby.
customer_reviews.author: Riezel Dow

customer_reviews.title: Nice quiet time toy
customer_reviews.text: Great toy I only wish the dog was removable. Otherwise it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy’s Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids on the go!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice learning toy with lots to do....and it all fits nicely inside the case which is part of the toy! Also a handle for the child to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Crazynana

customer_reviews.title: Melissa and Doug take along
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for a friend’s daughter. She loved it and kept her entertained.
customer_reviews.author: Just Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandson's 1st birthday. Well made. He enjoys playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Babyeaglemom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! Holds up well
customer_reviews.text: Love this activity. Very sturdy and has held up for over 3 years now. I use it almost every day doing home health for pediatrics.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Warren

customer_reviews.title: little ones love to carry their toys!!
customer_reviews.text: Keeps her entretained for hours and she uses the bag to carry her toys eveywhere
customer_reviews.author: Rosina

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Love that the gift is in a carry package. Will give for first birthdays.
customer_reviews.author: OBXers

customer_reviews.title: Well made but design flaw
customer_reviews.text: As others said, the little shapes get stuck on the pieces that have previously gone into the shape sorter. It's very nicely made, attractive and sturdy. It is not an independent activity for a 14 month old.
customer_reviews.author: deny45

customer_reviews.title: Love the concept, but it doesn't quite work
customer_reviews.text: I loved the idea of this, but my child has had a hard time putting the shapes into the travel kit because the shapes don't go in easily. The fabric bag that the shapes go in is quite narrow, so you have to push the shapes in and move them around to make them stay. I wish it were wider so it would be easier for my child to use.
customer_reviews.author: M Jones

customer_reviews.title: Fun travel toy!
customer_reviews.text: The quality I rely on with Melissa and Doug! Good size and weight for my two year old to be able to tote around herself!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Best Gift I have ever received!
customer_reviews.text: This has entertained my child from 7mos to now 10mos. I take it everywhere and it is easy to transport, durable and educational. I truly could not want anything more in a toy and it allows me to stash other toys in it too. Best travel and on the go learning item I own to date. I would buy this again and again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun for kids, needs a cover flap for the part with the shapes.
customer_reviews.text: Good product but it does suffer for the shapes falling back out from time to time in travel. I have spent hours looking for a piece here and there to find that they fell out in the bag. Wish it had a cover for the front puzzle part. Other than that my girls love it. Great for my 2 1/2 year old and my 18th month little one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Scott Musial

customer_reviews.title: Fun for baby, with help
customer_reviews.text: I gifted this for a 1 year old. It’s fun for learning shapes. My only complaint is the soft sides of the toy. It collapses, and it is too shallow to push the shapes all the way inside. I had to help him create room to push them in.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this toy so I could keep my 1 year old entertained in the plane ride and it was a great idea. The bag is soft and easy to carry, it comes with nine assorted shapes and they can be stored inside the bag without any issues. In the back of the bag, there are several tabs that can be pulled up or down with more shapes and colorful pictures. My son loved it!
customer_reviews.author: angie_colombia

customer_reviews.title: Color is bright and easy for baby to handle
customer_reviews.text: It is easy for busy little hands love the right colors and the dog that opens this toy olored and bright
customer_reviews.author: Carole Muzquiz

customer_reviews.title: Best travel toy ever.
customer_reviews.text: Best travel toy ever. Toddler loved it! Easy to keep together. Perfectly designed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect shape sorter for little ones!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 6 month old granddaughter and everyone loved it! It is perfect for taking with her anywhere she goes and the best part is that it is soft and not like the hard plastic shape sorters you usually see. No worries about little ones getting banged up on this when starting to pull themselves up on things and accidentally falling over into the toys.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of baby's favorites
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter when she was about 6 months old. At that point, it was just bright colors that she could put in her mouth. She has continued to remain interested in it (she is now 10 months old), and is now beginning to attempt to drop the shapes through the holes. Of all of her toys, this is the one that most consistently can get and maintain her attention. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Knight

customer_reviews.title: Good variety of activities
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for a nephew. Seemed durable and offered a variety of activities - the sorting, carrying the bag around, loading it with other items, a little fine motor with the zipper... A good size and easy to take along (hence, the name...) because it is soft. Another cute toy from Melissa and Doug!
customer_reviews.author: MEG

customer_reviews.title: shape sorter
customer_reviews.text: this is a good toy for dinner or car rides
customer_reviews.author: mason crossland

customer_reviews.title: Great for organized parents
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 17 month old for Christmas. She likes the zipper pouch and zipping up her shapes. I love how it’s a great on the go toy and has its own storage area for the shapes. Minimal mess and small likelihood of losing pieces.
customer_reviews.author: J. Deagan

customer_reviews.title: Not enough space between shape hole and bottom of containment
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by my childs teacher so I guess teacher knows best, my son likes it which is why I'm giving it 4 stars, but I dont like when you put the shapes in their corresponding hole the shape doesnt have enough space to plop down so it hovers in the hole... It's hard to explain but yeah, just okay.
customer_reviews.author: mildred l nunez

product_meta.title: Melissa & Doug Take-Along Shape Sorter
product_meta.description:
More than a shape sorter--this is an on-the-go activity center! Using nine plastic shapes and the padded carrying case, children can lift crinkly flaps, identify the pictures, match the shapes, and drop the textured blocks through the sorter . . . then pull the plush dog around the edge to unzip the case and start it all again! The baby- and toddler-friendly games and learning activities are great for enjoying together or for independent play, and are sure to keep little ones giggling while they learn. The easy-to-grasp padded handle makes it easy to carry the whole set from place to place--even for crawlers, scooters, and emerging walkers. Melissa & Doug K's Kids toys nurture early childhood development in three key skill areas: physical, cognitive, and social. With interactive designs and multisensory features, K's Kids promotes constructive play and effortless learning, keeping interest high and new skills flourishing throughout the baby and toddler years! Melissa & Doug K’s Kids toys nurture early childhood development in three key skill areas: physical, cognitive, and social. With interactive designs and multisensory features, K’s Kids promotes constructive play and effortless learning, keeping interest high and new skills flourishing throughout the baby and toddler years! This toy bag for travel helps babies and toddlers develop sensory, fine motor, and communication skills. The Take-Along Shape-Sorter Baby and Toddler Toy makes a great gift for kids ages 9 months and up. For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC News called “the gold standard in early childhood play.” Today, Melissa & Doug is proudly partnering with the American Academy of Pediatrics to foster early brain development and help children build important life skills through play.

BRAND STORY
By

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From classic wooden toys to crafts, pretend play, and games, Melissa & Doug products provide a launch pad to ignite imagination and a sense of wonder in all children so they can discover themselves, their passions, and their purpose. 

Since the company’s founding more than 25 years ago, Melissa & Doug has consistently delivered innovative products that inspire open-ended thinking, encourage kids to see new possibilities, and offer Countless Ways to Play. It’s part of a bigger vision to Take Back Childhood. Because by giving children a true childhood with the space and freedom to explore their world, we give them a path to realizing their full potential!

See more
feature_bullets: PADDED SHAPE-SORTER: The Take-Along Shape-Sorter is part of the K’s Kids line of early developmental toys. It includes a padded case with 2 activity sides, a take-along handle, and 9 textured blocks in 9 colors and various shapes.
CRINKLY FLAPS: Our toddler shape-sorter toy includes crinkly flaps that have pictures of familiar items above and matching shapes beneath.
HELPS SKILLS DEVELOPMENT: This toy bag for travel helps babies and toddlers develop sensory, fine motor, and communication skills.

GIFT FOR KIDS 9 MONTHS AND UP: The Take-Along Shape-Sorter Toy makes a great gift for kids ages 9 months and up. Add the Melissa & Doug Rainbow Stacker Classic Toy to round out the enriching developmental play experience.

“THE GOLD STANDARD IN CHILDHOOD PLAY”: For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC News called “the gold standard in early childhood play.”

100% HAPPINESS GUARANTEE: We design every toy to the highest quality standards, and to nurture minds and hearts. If your child is not inspired, give us a call and we'll make it right. Our phone number is on every product!
